info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 30 at 3:51PM EDT until October 30 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Upton NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following county, Nassau.
* WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a line of heavy showers approaching Nassau County. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area and could impact the evening commute. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Levittown, Freeport, Valley Stream, Long Beach, Glen Cove, Plainview, Garden City, Massapequa, Lynbrook, Syosset, Mineola, Woodmere, Westbury, Farmingdale, Oyster Bay, Jones Beach, Hempstead, Hicksville, Elmont and Oceanside. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
